actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 107-860.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Bingaman without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 664.

official_title: A bill to designate Fort Bayard Historic District in the State of New Mexico as a National Historic Landmark, and for other purposes.
short_title: Fort Bayard National Historic Landmark Act
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Fort Bayard National Historic Landmark Act - (Sec. 3) Designates the Fort Bayard Historic District in Grant County, New Mexico, as the Fort Bayard National Historic Landmark.(Sec. 4) Allows the Secretary of the Interior to enter into cooperative agreements with and provide assistance to public or private entities to protect historic resources at Fort Bayard and to provide educational and interpretive facilities and programs for the public. Prohibits the Secretary from entering into any agreements or providing assistance to any activities affecting Fort Bayard State Hospital without the concurrence of the State of New Mexico.(Sec. 5) Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: Fort Bayard National Historic Landmark Act
Fort Bayard National Historic Landmark Act
A bill to designate Fort Bayard Historic District in the State of New Mexico as a National Historic Landmark, and for other purposes.
